result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amy L Vivirito

defendant.name: Vivirito, Amy L
defendant.address: W4099 Linton Rd Apt 4, Lake Geneva, WI 53147

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDED 8/31/2022: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH M.J.S. OR RESIDENCE. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party.*

Defendant Amy L Vivirito in court.  Attorney Grace Hagerman in court for Amy L Vivirito.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim present in court. Motion to amend bond by Attorney Hagerman. No violent contact with victim. Offer received and accepting, plea set out for 90 days. Minutes filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Request to Lift the No Contact. Control Plan filed.
Victim's Request to Lift the No Contact

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

. Defendant Amy L Vivirito in court.  Attorney Grace Hagerman in court for Amy L Vivirito. Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond denied. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved. Victim present in court; make statement. Defense request no contact be lifted. State request no contact remains. Court makes record will not lift the no contact until procedures have been followed by parties. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDED 8/31/2022: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH M.J.S. OR RESIDENCE. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party.*

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT M.J.S. or residence. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant in court in custody via video with attorney Josh Ryan Polczinksi for bond purposes. Does qualify for SPD. DA Wiedenfeld appears for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
